intro: Thesium dollineri subsp. dollineri, commonly known as the dwarf thesium, is a low-growing perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by distinctive, triangular seed pods. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
